tp:docstring.p: Interface for channels where you may put the channel on hold. This only makes sense for channels where you are streaming media to or from the members.

If you place a channel on hold, this indicates that you do not wish to be sent media streams by any of its members and will be ignoring any media streams you continue to receive. It also requests that the connection manager free up any resources that are only needed for an actively used channel (e.g. in a GSM or PBX call, it will be necessary to place an active call on hold before you can start another call).

method.name: GetHoldState

arg.name: Held
arg.tp:docstring: True if the local user has placed the channel on hold.

method.tp:docstring: Return whether the local user has placed the channel on hold.

signal.name: HoldStateChanged

arg.name: Held
arg.tp:docstring: True if the local user has placed the channel on hold.

signal.tp:docstring: Emitted to indicate that the hold state has changed for this channel. This may occur as a consequence of you requesting a change with RequestHold, or the state changing as a result of a request from another process.

method.name: RequestHold

arg.name: Hold
arg.tp:docstring: A boolean indicating whether or not the channel should be on hold

method.tp:docstring: Request that the channel be put on hold (be instructed not to send any media streams to you) or be taken off hold. Success is indicated by the HoldStateChanged signal being emitted and by a successful return from this method.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: The requested hold state cannot be achieved; for example, if only a limited number of channels can be in the "not on hold" state, attempts to exceed this number will raise NotAvailable.
